sourceMeaningMnemonic: If a <radical>tsunami</radical> hits while you're <radical>farming</radical>, you'll have to wear really <kanji>thick</kanji> clothes to deal with it. The water is thick with fish and cars and other ripped-up debris too, which makes it even harder.
meaningInfo: Imagine putting on your thick farming suit as the tsunami comes at you. You hold onto your hoe and brace yourself for the wall of water.
readingMnemonic: You knew to put on your <kanji>thick</kanji> tsunami-proof farming gear because <reading>No</reading>stradamus (<ja>のう</ja>) warned you it was coming. He sent a message to your brain yesterday so you'd know what to wear today.
readingInfo: Thanks Nostradamus, now I'm in my nice, thick gear, struggling to hoe my fields through this wall of tsunami water. But I'm not dead and I'm not wet.
